title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: In July 2013, it was revealed that Silver and his FiveThirtyEight blog would depart The New York Times and join ESPN. In its announcement of its acquisition of FiveThirtyEight, ESPN reported that "Silver will serve as the editor-in-chief of the site and will build a team of journalists, editors, ...

title: ABC News acquires FiveThirtyEight - 2018-04-17 - Crunchbase Acquisition Profile
snippet: ABC News acquires FiveThirtyEight on 2018-04-17 for an undisclosed amount

title: FiveThirtyEight joins ABC News - ABC News
snippet: Added Connor Schell, executive vice president of content at ESPN, “FiveThirtyEight has been a tremendous asset to ESPN since Nate and the team joined us in 2013 and we are thrilled about their new home at ABC News.

title: Nate Silver of FiveThirtyEight’s advice to founders | Fortune
snippet: FiveThirtyEight.com, named after the number of votes in the Electoral College, was founded in 2008 by Silver as a data-driven news site that covered politics, economics, and sports—or, in other words, a blog. It grew out of Silver’s election forecasting, initially anonymously, as a blogger for the progressive site Daily Kos.
